source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk1
evidence_span: Material部分
composition_raw: Niobium: 2.4-2.8 wt%, Oxygen: 900-1300 ppma, Carbon: <270 ppm, Chromium: <200 ppm, Hydrogen: <25 ppmb, Iron: <1500 ppm, Nickel: <70 ppm, Nitrogen: <65 ppm, Silicon: <120 ppm, Tantalum: <200 ppm, Zirconium: balance
process_step: 双真空电弧重熔→锻造→机加工成空心坯料→815℃挤压(挤压比10.5:1)→冷拔→400℃24小时高压釜处理

extra_properties.微观结构: 双相结构：α相(六方密堆积，含约1 wt% Nb)+β相(体心立方，含约20 wt% Nb)
extra_properties.晶粒尺寸: α晶粒径向宽度0.2-0.5 μm，长宽比1:5:50(径向:横向:轴向)
extra_properties.织构特征: α晶粒择优取向，基面法线分布在径向-横向平面，最大值在横向方向

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk1
evidence_span: ABSTRACT和正文
composition_raw: Niobium: 2.4-2.8 wt%, Oxygen: 900-1300 ppma, Carbon: <270 ppm, Chromium: <200 ppm, Hydrogen: <25 ppmb, Iron: <1500 ppm, Nickel: <70 ppm, Nitrogen: <65 ppm, Silicon: <120 ppm, Tantalum: <200 ppm, Zirconium: balance

extra_properties.断裂韧性变化: 辐照前后韧性存在相关性，多数管材在CANDU反应堆寿命早期发生退化(注量<2×10²⁴ n·m⁻²)
extra_properties.韧性饱和: 相对低韧性材料的韧性饱和在约1.6×10²⁵ n·m⁻²完成
extra_properties.微观机制: 存在微偏析元素(氯和碳化物)和颗粒(磷化物和碳化物)等空洞形核位点时，辐照导致韧性大幅降低

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk2
evidence_span: ppm by weight. 0 ppm hydrogen oringot, $2 5 \ \mathsf { p p m }$ hydrogen for final tube.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk2
evidence_span: Only Tube 622 had been autoclaved before being received by AECL.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk2
evidence_span: the billets for Tubes G1175, H190M, H737, and H850 had been heated into the $\beta$ -phase and water-quenched before extrusion

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk2
evidence_span: the tensile and fracture toughness specimens (except those from Tube 622) were stress-relieved at $4 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathbf { C }$ for $2 4 \mathtt { h }$ in vacuum

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk2
evidence_span: the flattened transverse tension specimens from Tube 622 were given a minimum stress relief at $4 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathbf { C }$ for $\mathbf { 1 \cdot h }$

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk2
evidence_span: Each canister was irradiated in the NRU reactor to a different target fast-neutron fluence of 2, 5, and $1 0 \times 1 0 ^ { 2 4 } \mathrm { ~ n ~ } \cdot \mathrm { ~ m ~ } ^ { - 2 }$ $( E > 1$ MeV), at a flux of $1 . 6 \times 1 0 ^ { 1 7 } \mathrm { ~ n ~ } \cdot \mathrm { ~ m ~ } ^ { - 2 } \cdot \mathrm { ~ s ~ } ^ { - 1 }$ and an irradiation temperature of $2 5 5 ^ { \circ } \mathbf { C } \pm { \mathfrak { s } } ^ { \circ } \mathbf { C } .$
conditions: fast-neutron fluence: 2-10×10²⁴ n/m² (E>1MeV), flux: 1.6×10¹⁷ n/m²/s, temperature: 255±5°C

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk2
evidence_span: The $\mathbf { Z r } \mathbf { - } 2 . 5 \mathbf { N b }$ pressure tubes in Pickering NGS (PNGS) A Unit 3 operated between 1972 and 1989 (117 330 effective full power hours)

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk2
evidence_span: fast-neutron flux profile that was a flattened cosine along the tube length with a maximum value of about $2 . 5 \times 1 0 ^ { 1 7 } \mathrm { ~ n ~ } \cdot \mathrm { ~ m ~ } ^ { - 2 } \cdot \mathrm { ~ s ~ } ^ { - 1 }$ $( E > 1 \ \mathbf { M e V } )$ at the center

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk2
evidence_span: the operating temperature of the tubes varying from about $2 5 0 \mathrm { { ^ \circ C } }$ (inlet) to about $2 9 0 ^ { \circ } \mathbf { C }$ (outlet)

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk2
evidence_span: test matrix with a range of fluence varying from 6.5 to $9 . 8 \times 1 0 ^ { 2 5 } \mathrm { n } \cdot \mathrm { m } ^ { - 2 }$

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk2
evidence_span: the irradiation temperature (axial location) of each irradiated ring that varied from 254 to $2 8 7 \mathrm { } \mathrm { } ^ { \circ } \mathbf { C }$

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk2
evidence_span: The flux profile along the length of the insert is a cosine with a maximum flux of $1 . 8 9 \times 1 0 ^ { 1 8 } \mathrm { ~ n ~ } \cdot \mathrm { ~ m ~ } ^ { - 2 } \cdot \mathrm { ~ s ~ } ^ { - 1 }$ at the center and a gradual drop off such that the end specimens receive $71 \%$ of the maximum

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk3
evidence_span: After machining, all specimens were heat-treated at 400°C in vacuum to produce a similar stress-relieved condition; the tension specimens were heat-treated for an additional 48 h (total of 72 h), and the fracture toughness specimens for 72 h

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk3
evidence_span: specimens had received fast-neutron fluences in the range of 4.5×10²⁴ to 2.75×10²⁵ n·m⁻² (E > 1 MeV)

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk3
evidence_span: Additional sets of transverse tension and curved compact specimens are being irradiated in the NRU reactor at 255°C to fast-neutron fluences of 3, 6, and 9×10²⁴ n·m⁻² (E > 1 MeV) at a flux of 1.6×10¹⁷ n·m⁻²·s⁻¹

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk3
evidence_span: conversion of fluence to dpa for the reactors is about 1 dpa = 4.1×10²⁴ n·m⁻²

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk3
evidence_span: specimens from eight preselected tube materials irradiated in the NRU to a fast-neutron fluence of 2.1×10²⁴ n·m⁻² received 0.51 dpa

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk3
evidence_span: irradiated specimens machined from PNGS A Unit 3 reactor tubes received from 15.8 to 23.9 dpa

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk3
evidence_span: specimens from Tube H737 received from 1.1 to 6.7 dpa compared with 0.71 dpa for the NRU control specimens

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk3
evidence_span: transverse tension specimens were tested at a nominal strain rate of 10⁻³ s⁻¹ at 240°C (low-fluence or high-flux irradiation programs) or 250°C (high-fluence irradiation program)

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk3
evidence_span: yield stress of the unirradiated material from the centers of the eight different tubes ranged from 553 MPa (Tube B439) to 634 MPa (Tube H190M)

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk3
evidence_span: After irradiation in NRU to a fluence of 2.1×10²⁴ n·m⁻², the range in yield stress increased to 802 MPa (Tube B439) to 884 MPa (Tube H190M); that is, an increase in yield stress of about 250 MPa

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk3
evidence_span: UTS ranged from 596 MPa (Tube B439) to 679 MPa (Tube H190M) before irradiation; that is, 83 MPa After irradiation, the range in UTS had increased to 803 MPa to 889 MPa, respectively, an increase in UTS of about 210 MPa

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk3

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk5
evidence_span: Distribution of J-R curves for irradiated material tested at 240°C (preselected material irradiated in NRU at 255°C to a fast-neutron fluence of 2.1×10²⁴ n·m⁻²)
conditions: 240°C test temperature, 255°C irradiation temperature, 2.1×10²⁴ n·m⁻² fast-neutron fluence

extra_properties.crack_growth_behavior: three-stage crack growth behavior (Stage 1: initial sharp reduction in slope, Stage 2: sharp increase in slope, Stage 3: steadily decreasing slope beyond load maximum)
extra_properties.crack_jumps: up to 0.1 mm at crack extensions <1.5 mm, 0.2-0.5 mm at larger extensions for lower toughness specimens

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk5
evidence_span: Correlation between the crack growth toughness of irradiated and unirradiated material at 240°C (preselected material irradiated in NRU at 255°C to a fast-neutron fluence of 2.1×10²⁴ n·m⁻²)
conditions: 240°C test temperature, 255°C irradiation temperature, 2.1×10²⁴ n·m⁻² fast-neutron fluence

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk5
evidence_span: Distribution of J-R curves for irradiated material tested at 250°C (PNGS A Unit 3 material irradiated at 254 to 287°C to a fast-neutron fluence of 6.5 to 9.8×10²⁵ n·m⁻²)
conditions: 250°C test temperature, 254-287°C irradiation temperature, 6.5-9.8×10²⁵ n·m⁻² fast-neutron fluence

extra_properties.crack_growth_behavior: three-stage crack growth behavior with extent of Stage 1 increasing with decreasing toughness
extra_properties.crack_jumps: up to 0.23 mm at <2 mm crack growth for lowest toughness material
extra_properties.toughness_variation: wide variation in toughness both before and after irradiation

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk5
evidence_span: Correlation between toughness of irradiated and unirradiated material for PNGS Unit 3 test matrix
conditions: 250°C test temperature, 254-287°C irradiation temperature, 6.5-9.8×10²⁵ n·m⁻² fast-neutron fluence

extra_properties.toughness_correlation: confirmed correlation between irradiated and unirradiated material
extra_properties.toughness_reduction: most tubes showed significant reduction in toughness with irradiation (from <150 MPa to <50 MPa)
extra_properties.irradiation_temperature_effect: possible effect of irradiation temperature for lower toughness tubes (less reduction in toughness with increasing irradiation temperature)

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk6
evidence_span: Correlation between the crack growth toughness of irradiated and unirradiated material at 250°C (PNGS A Unit 3 material irradiated at 254 to 287°C to a fast-neutron fluence of 6.5 to 9.8×10²⁵ n·m⁻²)

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk6
evidence_span: Effect of neutron fluence on crack growth toughness of Tube H737 at 240°C (preselected material irradiated in OSIRIS and NRU at 250/255°C)

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk6
evidence_span: After mechanical testing, duplicate hydrogen samples (500-mg buttons) were punched from a selection of irradiated test specimens and analyzed by hot vacuum extraction mass spectrometry

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk6
evidence_span: Optical and scanning electron fractographic studies were carried out on a selection of fracture toughness specimens from each test program

extra_properties.irradiation_effect: enhanced fissure appearance and reduced dimple size

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk7
evidence_span: fissure intersecting the fatigue crack tip
conditions: 240°C test temperature, NRU irradiation at 255°C to 2.1×10²⁴ n·m⁻² fast-neutron fluence

extra_properties.fissure_characteristics: initiates from fatigue crack with no crack-tip blunting, indicative of low void nucleation strain
extra_properties.microstructure: elongated granular zone with fragmented grains

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk7

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk8

extra_properties.dislocation_structure: a-type loops forming during irradiation, no apparent c-component loop formation
extra_properties.c-component_defects: network dislocations show signs of splitting into partials
extra_properties.precipitation: little evidence for significant β-Nb precipitation in α-phase
extra_properties.iron_dispersion: iron dispersed with irradiation, increasing with fluence

extra_properties.microstructure: c-component network dislocations with splitting into partials

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk10
evidence_span: The results from the low- and high-fluence irradiation programs have demonstrated that the major reduction in toughness of Zr-2.5Nb pressure tube material occurs early in the lifetime of a reactor at fluences < 2 × 10²⁴ n·m⁻², with little further reduction at higher fluences

extra_properties.fracture_toughness_reduction: major reduction early in reactor life

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_012_chunk10
evidence_span: the high-toughness Tube 230 showed little evidence of any significant reduction in toughness with irradiation

extra_properties.toughness_response: little evidence of significant reduction with irradiation
